primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God acts to restore life to the dead (Israel/Lazarus/The Hearer) not based on human merit but for the sake of His own holy name.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am about to act... for the sake of my holy name
I will put my Spirit within you
His righteousness reaches out and snatches us
snatches us from the very jaws of death
because of God’s essential nature going out toward us in love and mercy

ontvanger.identificatie: The House of Israel / The Hearer / The 'Ungodly'

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Prophet (as mouthpiece) / Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: he brought me out by the Spirit

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is presented as an absolute state (dry bones/four-day-dead Lazarus) that no human effort can reverse.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to achieve peace through 'righteousness' or 'good works'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human (Mrs. McInerney / The Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is shown to fail completely, necessitating the primary program (God's action).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Holy Name → Salvation → The Ungodly

voorbeelden_god_subject: His righteousness reaches out and snatches us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are all in this together

voorbeelden: God’s determined purpose to raise the dead
She had not heard, or had not understood, the gospel
no match for the Holy Spirit of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses almost entirely on God's 'ability' to do what man 'cannot' do. It is a theology of divine competence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Death/Bones) through the failure of ~S1 (Mrs. McInerney's works) to the resolution in S1 (God's Name).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by acting 'for His own sake,' bypassing human merit.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is 'very dry' and sin is 'terrible'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon explicitly rejects human agency as the cause of salvation, placing the 'engine' of the narrative entirely in God's character.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: It is not for your sake... but for the sake of my holy name
snatches us from the very jaws of death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Ezekiel is a witness/mouthpiece, not a hero to emulate. Lazarus is a passive corpse.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who connects the bones.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; removal of the burden of self-justification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cultural critique to the biblical text is seamless, unified by the theme of 'myth' vs 'reality'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'saintly' life of Mrs. McInerney and her 'terrible' sin.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: his righteousness reaches out and snatches us

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit gives the 'Pouvoir' (life) that the bones lack.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a Grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the sole Subject of the primary soteriological program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; appropriate for Lent.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and enables the (implied) ethics.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful homiletical movement that strips the hearer of false competence to reveal divine grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'highbrow' anecdotes, Greimas reveals that these stories serve to illustrate the failure of the Human-as-Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of 'bones' to show how the text functions as a 'Subject-switch' from Israel to Yahweh.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Gospel verse' in Ezekiel 36:22 is the structural 'Sender' (the source of value) for the entire sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by focusing on the deadness of the actors.
